meanings.definition: Tizes (noun): A unit of measurement equal to ten.
meanings.sent1: In the store, you can buy a pack of tizes candies for a dollar.
meanings.sent2: She counted the marbles and found they were in multiples of tizes.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to bring exactly tizes pencils to class.
meanings.sent4: The tizes of fingers on our hands make it easier to hold things.
meanings.sent5: The recipe called for a tizes of chocolate chips to be added to the batter.

meanings.definition: Tizes (verb): To arrange or organize in groups of ten.
meanings.sent1: He decided to tizes the books on the shelf by their colors.
meanings.sent2: The farmer tizes the eggs in cartons of ten for sale.
meanings.sent3: She likes to tizes her socks in pairs to keep them organized.
meanings.sent4: The students tizes themselves into teams of ten for the game.
meanings.sent5: The chef will tizes the vegetables before chopping them for the salad.

meanings.definition: Tizes (adjective): Describing something that is divided into groups of ten.
meanings.sent1: The tizes boxes of crayons were neatly stacked on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The store sells tizes packs of colored pencils for art projects.
meanings.sent3: She bought a tizes set of markers to use for her drawings.
meanings.sent4: The tizes rows of flowers in the garden looked beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The tizes slices of pizza were perfect for the party guests.
